channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: France allots P2 million for Philippines COVID response system
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: France has allocated additional funding of 2 million euros in grants to strengthen the surveillance, diagnosis and response systems of the Philippines and four other Southeast Asian countries to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Go to government, LGUs: Prepare attractive trade, industry policies
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has urged the national and local governments to begin drawing up a stable and conducive policy environment that will entice stakeholders and investors to start businesses in the provinces to support the plan for the implementation of a “Balik Probinsya” program once the country overcomes the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: 3 Philippine cities finalists in WWF competition
item.author: Rhodina Villanueva
item.description: The cities of Batangas, Muntinlupa and Santa Rosa have been selected as national finalists in the World Wide Fund for Nature “One Planet City Challenge ” this year.

item.title: Philippines protest China’s latest SCS actions
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: The Philippines “strongly” protested China’s establishment of two new districts in the disputed South China Sea and the illegal designation of Kagitingan Reef within the Kalayaan Island Group as administrative center of “Nansha” district.

item.title: 2 priests pass 2019 Bar exams
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Catholic priest Fr. Abundio Bacatan just wanted to become knowledgeable about the basic laws in the country. But he went on to study law and the clergyman is now in the roll of attorneys after he passed – on his first take – the 2019 Bar examinations.

item.title: Pinoy nurse among recipients of COVID-19 trial drugs
item.author: Ghio Ong
item.description: A Filipino nurse based in California who once tested positive for the coronavirus disease 2019 was among the patients worldwide who received medications that are currently undergoing trial to test their efficacy to treat the dreaded illness.

item.title: Residents in GCQ areas can attend mass, work gatherings
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: tarting today, people living in areas classified under general community quarantine may attend mass and other religious services as well as engage in essential work activities as the government relaxes the quarantine procedures in the fight against coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: DOT to focus on domestic tourism market
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: The Department of Tourism will focus its recovery efforts on the domestic market before targeting international markets, given travel restrictions around the world and the reluctance of people to travel due to the coronavirus disease pandemic.

item.title: Pfizer sees vaccine by September; Remdesivir proves effective
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Pfizer Inc. has announced it could have a coronavirus vaccine ready by the fall, according to a report in The Daily Mail.

item.title: Labor Day: Recovery program for workers to be unveiled
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: As the world marks Labor Day today, the Duterte administration announced it will launch a recovery plan for workers as the country grapples with the impact of the Luzon-wide quarantine set in place to check the spread of the coronavirus disease 2019.
